newsitem.title: UK: Euro fuel oil rises gently on supply worries.
newsitem.headline: Euro fuel oil rises gently on supply worries.

text.p: Euro fuel oil gained on Thursday as supply worries hit the market, with the Rotterdam and Antwerp barge market maintaining its surprising summer strength, traders said.

High sulphur barges traded at $93, $93.25 and $93.50 as 25-30,000 tonnes of bunker demand entered the ARA market. Prices later sank back 50 cents to quote at $92.50/$93.50 a tonne. The gyrations in the crude price in the last 24 hours had little effect, traders added.
Low sulphur also gained a little, with swaps for August quoted at $94.25/$95, up from $93/$94.

Some said the gain was just to maintain the minimum differential between high and low sulphur quotes while others said a perception had crept in that August one percent cargoes were not as generously supplied as previously thought.

The anticipated flood of cracked Russian material has not materialised or is being steadily absorbed, traders said. Cracked M100 was heard bought at two means plus $1.15 and other offers were heard in the $1 to $2 range.
A large trader was seen enquiring for an 80kt vessel for first week August to take Baltic fuel trans-atlantic but some doubted the arbitrage could be made to work at current numbers.
